mainEntity.name: What is the Quran app and where can I download it?

acceptedAnswer.text: Our Quran app is a mobile application for reading, listening, and understanding the Qur’an. It’s available on the Google Play Store with full features like audio recitation, translations, and bookmarks.

mainEntity.name: Can I read the full Quran on the app?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, the app contains all 114 Surahs (chapters) of the Quran in Arabic, with verse-by-verse translations and transliterations.

mainEntity.name: Does the app include audio recitations for each Surah?

acceptedAnswer.text: Absolutely! You can listen to multiple reciters for each Surah, with offline support so you can play audio without an internet connection.

mainEntity.name: What is transliteration and why is it included?

acceptedAnswer.text: Transliteration shows Arabic verses written in Latin script (e.g. “Al‑Fātiḥah”) to help with pronunciation, especially for non‑Arabic speakers.

mainEntity.name: Are translations available in different languages?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, the app includes multiple translations such as English, Urdu, Bengali, and more. You can switch languages in settings.

mainEntity.name: Can I search for a specific Surah or Ayah in the app?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, you can search by Surah number, Ayah number, or keywords in Arabic and translation. This helps you find verses quickly.

mainEntity.name: Is there a feature for bookmarking verses?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, you can bookmark your favorite Ayahs and return to them easily. Bookmarks are stored locally for offline access.

mainEntity.name: Does the app support night mode for reading?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, there is a night/dark mode that improves readability and reduces eye strain during nighttime reading.

mainEntity.name: Can I download Surahs for offline reading?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, you can download selected Surahs or the entire Quran for offline reading, audio, and search.

mainEntity.name: What Surahs are included and how are they organized?

acceptedAnswer.text: The app includes all 114 Surahs in their canonical order, organized by Juz’. Each Surah displays its name, transliteration, translation, and verse count.

mainEntity.name: Does the app include Tajweed rules or color-coded text?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, we offer optional Tajweed (recitation) highlighting to help users pronounce verses correctly.

mainEntity.name: Is there an audio-only playback or Quran player mode?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, the app includes an audio player mode where you can play continuous recitation for a Surah or Juz’.

mainEntity.name: How do I switch between different reciters in the app?

acceptedAnswer.text: Go to Settings → Audio → Reciters, and select your preferred reciter. You can switch on the fly during playback.

mainEntity.name: Is there a daily verse reminder or notification?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, you can enable daily Ayah reminders through notifications in Settings → Notifications.

mainEntity.name: Can I use the app on tablets and large screens?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, the app is optimized for both mobile and tablet screens. It supports landscape orientation for comfortable reading.
